intro: Humboltia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coastlines, where it thrives in a Mediterranean climate. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. Humboltia biflora is known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect and bird populations.
